sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to intersection.
message_1: Let A = {2, 3, 5, 7, 11} and B = {3, 5, 7, 13, 17}. Find (A ∆ B) ∩ B and (B ∆ A) ∩ A. Show that the symmetric difference of A and B is not commutative with respect to intersection.
